english: What do you feel like eating?
He took a bite of the hamburger and put it down.
transliteration: ʔáʈam ʔáʈma min ilhambúrgur wi sābu.
arabic: قطم قطْمة مِن الهمْبُرْجُر و سابُه.

english: to take a bite of, take a sip of
She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
transliteration: xádit šáfʈit máyya wi sābit ilkubbāya.
arabic: خدِت شفْطِةْ ميّة و سابِت الكوبّايَة.

english: She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
transliteration: xádit buʔʔə máyya wi sābit ilkubbāya.
arabic: خدِت بُقّ ميّة و سابِت الكوبّايَة.

english: Chew carefully. You don’t want to choke on a fishbone.
transliteration: úmɖuɣ bi-rāɧa 3ašān ma-tišráʔšə min šōk issámak.
arabic: أُمْضُغ بِراحة عشان متِشْرقْش مِن شوْك السّمك.

english: I'm so thirsty. Could I have some water?
transliteration: ʔána 3aʈšān ʔáwi. múmkin tiddīni šwáyyit máyya?
arabic: أنا عطْشان أوي.  مُمْكِن تِدّيني شُوَيِّةْ ميّة؟

english: Taste the soup. Does it need salt?
I don’t like how it tastes.
The milk is past its expiration date.
How does the soup taste? - It’s a little salty.
arabic: أيْه رأْيَك في الشّورْبة؟ - مالْحة شُوَيَّة.

english: Potato chips are really bad for you.
If I feel hungry, I just have a small snack.
transliteration: lámma -ɧiss ʔínni ga3ān, baʔázʔaz ʔayyə ɧāga xafīfa.
arabic: لمّا أحِسّ إنّي جعان، بقزْقز أيّ حاجة خفيفة.

english: Can I have a glass of water, please?
There’s a can of cola in the fridge.
How would you like your (Turkish) coffee?
Egyptian ghee (made from water buffalo milk)
Eat your ice cream before it melts.
transliteration: kul ilʔāys krīm bitā3ak ʔablə ma ydūb.
arabic: كُلّ الآيس كْريم بِتاعك قبْل ما يْدوب.

english: Areesh cheese (similar to cottage cheese or Ricotta)
Halloumi cheese (semi-hard, unripened cheese made from goat milk)
Romy cheese (a sharp, pungent, hard cheese)
Dark chocolate is better for you than milk chocolate.
arabic: الشّوكولاتة الغامْقة أحْسنْلك مِن الشّوكولاتة بِاللبن.

english: kahk (shortbread stuffed with dates and nuts)
om ali (a very popular sweet bread pudding)
qatayef (sweet dumpling with nuts and cream)
I don’t feel like chicken. Let’s have beef.
transliteration: miš 3āyiz ʔākul firāx. ta3āl nigīb láɧma.
arabic: مِش عايِز آكُل فِراخ.  تعال نِجيب لحْمة.

english: This meat has a lot of fat on it.
This meat has a lot of fat on it.
Thank you for the meal! (said to host(ess) after having tried the food)
to talk with one’s mouth full
Don’t talk with your mouth full!
Could you pass the salt, please?
Excuse me for a moment. (when excusing oneself from the table)
Thank you for the meal. (said after finishing a meal in someone’s home)
